snp2.10:331: Arouse yourselves, sit up!What good to you is sleeping?For what sleep can there be for the afflicted,for those injured, pierced by the dart? (1) [58]
snp2.10:332: Arouse yourselves, sit up!Train vigorously for the state of peace.Do not let the King of Death, having caught you heedless,delude you who have come under his control. (2)
snp2.10:333: Cross over this attachmentby which devas and human beings,full of need, are held fast.Do not let the opportunity pass you by;for those who have missed the opportunitysorrow when they arrive in hell. (3)
snp2.10:334: Heedlessness is dust always,This pāda, as it has come down inEe, is missing three syllables. BothBeandCeduplicate a word,pamādo rajo pamādo. In the parallel,Theragatha 404,Cereadspamādo rajo sabbadā(Bepamādo rajo pamādo;Eepamādo rajo).Pj IIdoes not cite a lemma, but its comment,na hi kadāci pamādo nāma arajo atthi, may have been based on an original that hadsabbadā. I translate on the assumptionsabbadāshould be added to the line.dust follows upon heedlessness.By heedfulness, by clear knowledge,draw out the dart from oneself. (4)
